snippet: The unfolding saga between the offensive linemen Jonathan Martin and Richie Incognito of the Miami Dolphins is forcing the league to start defining the gray areas between pranks and bullying.
abstract: Unfolding saga between Miami Dolphins offensive linemen Jonathan Martin and Richie Incognito is forcing NFL to start defining gray areas between good-natured pranks and bullying; Martin abruptly left team after string of perceived slights and Incognito was suspended indefinitely after it was disclosed that he had left Martin racist and threatening texts and voice messages.

byline.original: By JOHN BRANCH and KEN BELSON
byline.contributor: Ben Shpigel contributed reporting from Florham Park, N.J.; Zach Schonbrun from East Rutherford, N.J.; and Billy Witz from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: The unfolding saga between the offensive linemen Jonathan Martin and Richie Incognito of the Miami Dolphins is forcing the league to start defining the gray areas between pranks and bullying.

headline.main: In Bullying Case, Questions on N.F.L. Culture
headline.print_headline: In Bullying Case, Questions on N.F.L. Culture
